Salesforce Components - EmailService.EmailMessage
Overview    Classes    Enums    Interfaces    Triggers    SObjects    Groups    Index




Class EmailService.EmailMessage

public class EmailService.EmailMessage

Wrapper class for SingleEmailMessage. Contains methods for sending email messages.

Members

Methods

public EmailService.EmailMessage addAddress(
  List<String> addressList,
  String addressType
)

Adds recipients to the message.

Parameters:
    addressList – List of email addresses or record IDs.
    addressType – Type of recipients. Valid values are: To, Cc, or Bcc.

Returns:
    EmailMessage: The current instance of the class.

Since:
    08/30/2024

public EmailService.EmailMessage addAddress(
  String address,
  String addressType
)

Adds a recipient to the message.

Parameters:
    address – Recipient's email address or record ID.
    addressType – Type of recipient. Valid values are: To, Cc, or Bcc.

Returns:
    EmailMessage: The current instance of the class.

    SingleEmailMessage object.

public EmailService.EmailMessageResult send()

Sends the email message.

Returns:
    EmailMessageResult object detailing the result of the send transaction.

public EmailService.EmailMessage setHtmlBody(String htmlTextBody)

Optional.The HTML version of the email, specified by the sender. The value is encoded according to the specification associated with the organization. Specify a value for setTemplateId, setHtmlBody, or setPlainTextBody. Or, you can define both setHtmlBody and setPlainTextBody.

Parameters:
    htmlTextBody – String: HTML version of the email.

Returns:
    EmailMessage: The current instance of the class.

Since:
    08/29/2024

public EmailService.EmailMessage setOrgWideEmailAddressId(Id orgWideEmailAddressId)

Sets the email address the message is sent from.

Parameters:
    orgWideEmailAddressId – Optional. The ID of the organization-wide email address associated with the outgoing email. If you’re using Apex to send emails from the guest user, set the sender to the verified org-wide email address or the emails are blocked. The object's DisplayName field cannot be set if the setSenderDisplayName field is already set.

Returns:
    EmailMessage: The current instance of the class.

public EmailService.EmailMessage setPlainTextBody(String plainTextBody)

Optional. The text version of the email, specified by the sender. Specify a value for setTemplateId, setHtmlBody, or setPlainTextBody. Or, you can define both setHtmlBody and setPlainTextBody.

Parameters:
    plainTextBody – When recipient replies to the email, the email is sent by default to this address.

Returns:
    EmailMessage: The current instance of the class.

public EmailService.EmailMessage setReplyTo(String emailAddress)

Sets the reply-to email address.

Parameters:
    emailAddress – When recipient replies to the email, the email is sent by default to this address.

Returns:
    EmailMessage: The current instance of the class.

Since:
    08/30/2024

public EmailService.EmailMessage setSubject(String subject)

Optional. The email subject line. If you are using an email template, the subject line of the template overrides this value.

Parameters:
    subject – Email subject.

Returns:
    EmailMessage: The current instance of the class.

public EmailService.EmailMessage setTargetObjectId(Id recordId)

Required if using a template, optional otherwise. The ID of the contact, lead, or user to which the email will be sent. The ID you specify sets the context and ensures that merge fields in the template contain the correct data.

Parameters:
    recordId – ID of the contact, lead, or user to which the email will be sent.

Returns:
    EmailMessage: The current instance of the class.

public EmailService.EmailMessage setTemplateId(Id templateId)

Optional. Sets the template used to create the email.

Parameters:
    templateId – The ID of the email template.

Returns:
    EmailMessage: The current instance of the class.

public EmailService.EmailMessage setTreatTargetObjectAsRecipient(Boolean treatAsRecipient)

Allows the targetObjectId to be treated as a recipient of the email or as the WhoId field for template rendering.

Parameters:
    treatAsRecipient – Optional. If set to true, the targetObjectId (a contact, lead, or user) is the recipient of the email. If set to false, the targetObjectId is supplied as the WhoId field for template rendering but isn’t a recipient of the email. The default is true.

Returns:
    EmailMessage: The current instance of the class.

public EmailService.EmailMessage setWhatId(Id recordId)

If you specify a contact for the targetObjectId field, you can specify an optional whatId as well. This helps to further ensure that merge fields in the template contain the correct data.

Parameters:
    recordId – ID of the related record used also to merge fields from the template.

Returns:
    EmailMessage: The current instance of the class.
